Array to ArrayList in java

13 Jun 2015

1. Use Arrays.asList()

Let's first looks its JAVA API below. We get that it returns a **fixed size List**

We have two ways to use it.

1) The first way is call asList(), in this way, the List it returns is fixed size. If you want to add new element to it, it will returns java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException 2) If you pass the return result of asList to the constructor of ArrayList, then you can add new element. Here is an example of these two ways.

2. Use Collections.addAll()

In this method, you can create an List with size of the array. But you can also add new element later. Here is an example:s

Additional notes

In above example, element in the array are objects, if we just have an int array, then we need special ways
